intro: Gaya calyptrata, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, leathery fruits. Gaya calyptrata is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
